isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Camshaft Assembly

note.para: This engine uses hydraulic valve tappets with roller followers. A roller follower guide is needed to maintain correct orientation of roller to cam lobe. Normal clearance between the valve tappet roller and guide allows for slight tracking of roller across cam lobe.

Tracking of the roller is normal when the roller accelerates and decelerates during engine operation. Consequently, a typical wear pattern on cam lobes will exhibit tracks from side to side, have wide and narrow areas from the loading and unloading of follower. The wear pattern (tracking) is normal and the camshaft does not require replacement.

step1.para: Inspect camshaft. If any lobes are scuffed, scored or cracked, replace camshaft assembly.
After inspection, evaluate camshaft main journal and lobe condition as follows:

note.para: When measuring the camshaft with a micrometer, always take two measurements 90° apart.

step2.para:
Use a 2-3 inch micrometer
to measure journal diameter of camshaft bearing. If bearing journals are worn beyond specification , install a new camshaft assembly.

figure.caption: Measurement of camshaft intake and exhaust lobes

step2.para:
To check camshaft intake and exhaust lobes, measure across (A to C) and across (B to D). Subtract (B to D) from (A to C). This will give cam lobe lift. Subtract this amount from maximum lobe lift in specifications
to obtain cam lobe wear measurement. Replace camshaft assembly if cam lobe wear exceeds specifications .

step1.para:
Inspect thrust plate for wear, cracks or distortion. Use a 0-1 inch micrometer
to measure thrust plate thickness. If thickness does not meet specification , replace camshaft assembly.
Inspect camshaft gear for worn or damaged teeth.
Wash camshaft in cleaning solvent with a soft brush.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).
